blocks.content: Claude Code is similar to Cursor Agent — it can directly rewrite and generate code. Why introduce Cursor first (previous section)? Because Claude Code can be used inside Cursor, which is like having two professional developers helping you. Here’s how to use Claude Code in Cursor.

blocks.title: ⚠️ Important
blocks.content: You need a Claude Pro or higher subscription to use Claude Code. Pricing is around $17/month (depending on region).

blocks.content: Cursor has an extension store where you can install different add-ons to make using Claude easier. I strongly recommend installing **Claude Code for VS Code** for one-click usage.
1. Go to the Cursor Extension Store
2. Install Claude Code for VS Code
3. Click the orange button on the top right — you can start using Claude Code instantly!
Sub-agent is Claude’s most powerful feature — it allows you to delegate different tasks to different agents. For example:

items: UI design
Code security review
Code refactoring
Frontend development

blocks.content: One-click download of the Sub-agents I use!

blocks.title: Sub-agent Download
blocks.content: Zip file containing all Sub-agents. Perfect for beginners to get started quickly. Just unzip and place in the `.claude/` folder and it will work automatically. (If `.claude/` does not exist, you can create it manually in the Cursor file area.)

items: Distribute complex tasks to specialized agents, improving efficiency.
Avoid overly long or incomplete single responses.
Example: Security Agent focuses on vulnerability checks, UI Agent focuses on interface design.

blocks.content: MCP is a standard protocol that allows Claude to directly connect with external resources (file systems, APIs, databases). Compared to copy-paste, it is much more efficient and secure.

items: Directly read local or cloud files for analysis.
Connect to GitHub repos for code reviews.
Query database schema and generate SQL queries.
Integrate APIs to reduce manual work.
Currently not recommended for beginners. Learn Claude Code first and practice manual workflows!

blocks.title: Tip
blocks.content: Think of MCP as the bridge between Claude and the outside world — best suited for project-level applications.

blocks.title: Summary
blocks.content: Claude Code = **Long context + Security review + Multi-agent collaboration**. Ideal for large projects, technical research, and security checks. A strong complement to ChatGPT and Cursor.

items.content: Open Claude, input a large code file, and ask it to generate an architectural explanation.
Ask Claude to run a security review on code (e.g., SQL Injection).
Try using Claude to refactor old code into modern syntax.
